t: For the director of music. To the tune of “Lilies.” Of the Sons of Korah. A maskil. A wedding song.
My*pn heart is stirred by a noble theme as*ld I recite my verses for the king; my*ld tongue is the pen of a skillful writer.
You*pn are the most excellent of men and*ld your lips have been anointed with grace, since*ld God has blessed you forever.
Gird*pn your sword on your side, you mighty one; clothe*ld yourself with splendor and majesty.
In*ln your majesty ride forth victoriously in*ld the cause of truth, humility and justice; let*ld your right hand achieve awesome deeds.
Let*ln your sharp arrows pierce the hearts of the king’s enemies; let*ld the nations fall beneath your feet.
Your*ln throne, O God, will last for ever and ever; a*ld scepter of justice will be the scepter of your kingdom.
You*ln love righteousness and hate wickedness; therefore*ld God, your God, has set you above your companions by*ld anointing you with the oil of joy.
All*ln your robes are fragrant with myrrh and aloes and cassia; from*ld palaces adorned with ivory the*ld music of the strings makes you glad.
Daughters*ln of kings are among your honored women; at*ld your right hand is the royal bride in gold of Ophir.
Listen,*pn daughter, and pay careful attention: Forget*ld your people and your father’s house.
Let*ln the king be enthralled by your beauty; honor*ld him, for he is your lord.
The*ln city of Tyre will come with a gift, people*ld of wealth will seek your favor.
All*ln glorious is the princess within her chamber; her*ld gown is interwoven with gold.
In*ln embroidered garments she is led to the king; her*ld virgin companions follow her— those*ld brought to be with her.
Led*ln in with joy and gladness, they*ld enter the palace of the king.
Your*pn sons will take the place of your fathers; you*ld will make them princes throughout the land.
I*pn will perpetuate your memory through all generations; therefore*ld the nations will praise you for ever and ever.
